skill.name: simplify
skill.description: Simplify and refine recently modified code for clarity and consistency. Use after writing code to improve readability without changing functionality.
skill.summary: Enhance code readability and consistency through automated simplification and refactoring.
skill.author: brianlovin

security_audit.summary: Static analyzer detected patterns for external commands and network access, but these are false positives. The skill is a text-based code simplification assistant that reviews code structure without executing code or making network requests. All findings are benign - the skill references CLAUDE.md documentation and discusses code patterns, not actual code execution or data exfiltration.

content.value_statement: Clean up and simplify your code after writing it. This skill enhances code readability and consistency without changing functionality. Great for developers who want their code to follow best practices and remain maintainable.
actual_capabilities: Improve code readability through better naming
Follow established React and JavaScript patterns
Maintain exact functionality while improving structure
limitations: Only works on text-based code review - cannot execute code
Cannot modify code outside recently modified sections
Cannot change the underlying logic or behavior
Requires access to CLAUDE.md for project standards
May not catch logic errors, only style and structure issues

use_cases.title: Post-Code Writing Polish
use_cases.description: Use immediately after writing or modifying code to clean it up and ensure it follows project standards. This is especially useful when working quickly on multiple changes.

use_cases.title: Code Review Preparation
use_cases.description: Apply simplification before showing code to reviewers. Clean, simplified code is easier to review and faster to understand.

use_cases.title: Project Onboarding
use_cases.description: When joining a new project, this skill helps align your code with existing standards and documentation before making major changes.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Code Simplification
prompt_templates.prompt: Simplify this recently modified code section to improve clarity while preserving all functionality: [PASTE_CODE]

prompt_templates.title: Complex Condition Simplification
prompt_templates.prompt: This code has nested ternary operators. Please simplify it using if/else chains or switch statements while keeping the behavior identical: [PASTE_CODE]

prompt_templates.title: Project Standard Compliance
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply project coding standards from CLAUDE.md to this code. Focus on: consistent naming, explicit types, proper error handling, and avoiding nested ternaries: [PASTE_CODE]

prompt_templates.title: Code Cleanup for Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Clean up and simplify this code for code review. Remove redundancy, improve readability, but do not change the logic or behavior: [PASTE_CODE]

output_examples.input: Calculate user score with nested ternary operators for bonus tiers
output_examples.output: Use if/else chain instead of nested ternaries for clarity and maintainability.

output_examples.input: Complex component with deeply nested conditionals
output_examples.output: Extract helper functions to reduce nesting and improve readability.
Simplify by removing unnecessary indirection and directly showing the logic.

best_practices: Apply this skill immediately after writing code to catch issues early
Review the changes carefully to ensure no functionality was lost
Keep the original version as backup until you confirm the simplified version works
Use project documentation (CLAUDE.md) to understand specific standards
Focus on clarity over brevity - explicit code is often better than clever one-liners
anti_patterns: Over-simplification that reduces readability or maintainability
Removing helpful abstractions that organize complex logic
Creating overly clever solutions that are hard to understand
Prioritizing fewer lines of code over clear, explicit logic
Combining too many responsibilities into single functions or components

faq.question: Does this skill actually execute my code?
faq.answer: No. This is a text-based code review skill. It analyzes your code structure and suggests improvements but never runs or tests the code.

faq.question: Will this change how my code works?
faq.answer: No. The skill is designed to preserve all functionality while only improving code style and structure. Logic and behavior remain unchanged.

faq.question: Why does it reference CLAUDE.md?
faq.answer: CLAUDE.md is a common community file that documents project-specific coding standards. The skill reads this file to understand your project's rules.

faq.question: Can I use this for large codebases?
faq.answer: The skill is most effective on recently modified sections. For large codebases, apply it incrementally to avoid reviewing too much code at once.

faq.question: What if I disagree with a simplification?
faq.answer: You can always revert changes or provide specific instructions to adjust the style. The skill prioritizes your preferences and requirements.

faq.question: Does it work with different programming languages?
faq.answer: The skill is designed primarily for JavaScript/TypeScript and React, but the principles apply to other languages as well.
